books.title: Passages from the Life of a Philosopher
books.author: Charles Babbage
books.summary: The eminent Victorian scientist and mathematician on his inventions, dreams and adventures.

books.title: The Survivors of the Chancellor
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: A record of the ill-fated voyage of the Chancellor as told by one of the passengers.

books.title: Memoirs of a Foxhunting Man
books.author: Siegfried Sassoon
books.summary: A young boy comes of age in the idyllic English countryside just before the Great War tears Europe apart.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Children’s Stories
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A collection of Oscar Wilde’s children’s stories.

books.title: Lady Windermere’s Fan
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A witty comedy that subverts the harsh social codes of Victorian England.

books.title: Troilus and Cressida
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A Trojan prince falls in love with a woman amid the Trojan War, only to see her exchanged to the Greeks for a prisoner of war.

books.title: The Return
books.author: Walter de la Mare
books.summary: After visiting a graveyard, a man finds his appearance has mysteriously changed.

books.title: The Black Tulip
books.author: Alexandre Dumas
books.summary: An unjustly imprisoned man longs after both his love and his tulips.

books.title: Ghost Stories
books.author: E. F. Benson
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories by E. F. Benson.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.

books.title: The Valley of Fear
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The final novel in Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s Sherlock Holmes series follows the eponymous hero as he investigates a Sussex murder seemingly connected with a secret society.

books.title: Democracy and Education
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A critical survey of the philosophy and aims of education in a democratic society.

books.title: The Practice and Theory of Bolshevism
books.author: Bertrand Russell
books.summary: Bertrand Russell travels to post-revolutionary Russia to see if Bolshevism achieves its communist aspirations.

books.title: Hudibras
books.author: Samuel Butler
books.summary: A knight and his squire set forth for adventure and love.

books.title: The Coming of Bill
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A domineering author of books on eugenics and hygiene makes a match between her niece and an idle artist, intending them to raise a son according to her principles, regardless of the consequences.

books.title: The Airlords of Han
books.author: Philip Francis Nowlan
books.summary: Science fiction hero Buck Rogers continues his crusade against the evil Han empire.

books.title: The Extraordinary Adventures of Arsène Lupin, Gentleman-Burglar
books.author: Maurice Leblanc
books.summary: An infamous French thief plans intricate ways of stealing precious paintings and jewellery in this first collection of Arsène Lupin short stories.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.
